titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the John B. Nelson papers, Rockefeller University Faculty FA183

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-11-01 15:09:16 -0400.

change.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvists’ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: John B. Nelson papers, Rockefeller University Faculty

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: John Brockway Nelson, researcher in animal pathology in the Department of Animal and Plant Pathology, Rockefeller Institute at Princeton, New Jersey from 1925 until 1950 and from 1950 until his retirement in June 1974 at the New York Laboratories. He worked primarily with diseases of the respiratory tract in animals and with latent viruses and tumors of mice. On his retirement, he presented without restriction, his professional correspondence, 1954-1974 to The Rockefeller University Archives.

eventgrp.event: Public Service Laboratories (State Department of Health) Agricultural Experiment Station, University of Kentucky
A.M. (Bacteriology and Pathology) Harvard University Assistant to Dr. Bronfenbrenner, Harvard Medical School
Ph. D. (Bacteriology and Pathology) University of Missouri Assistant in Department of Animal Husbandry
Instructor, Department of Microbiology, Univ. of Mass. (Fall term)
Assistant, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research at Department of Animal and Plant Pathology, Princeton, New Jersey
Associate Member, RIMR at Princeton, N.J.

Consultant to the Secretary of War, Army Epidemiological Board, Commission on Tropical Diseases (field and laboratory work on bacillary dysentery) ; Member of special subcommission to India for study of enteric diseases; temporary consultant on diseases of laboratory animals, University of Chicago metallurgical laboratory (Manhattan Project)
Griffin Award. Animal Care Panel, Chicago
Emeritus, Rockefeller University, New York, N.Y.

bioghist.p: Member of: American Association Adv. Sci. Animal Care Panel, Society of Experimental Pathology, Society Bact., Society of Experimental Biology

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, professional, and collected papers. Includes biographical material, bibliography and notes. Primarily a collection of professional correspondence.

John B. Nelson's chief scientific interest centered in naturally acquired diseases in laboratory animals, mainly mice and rats. The correspondence deals with strains of mice for experimental work, animal care facilities, care of experimental animals, publications, breeding, autopsies and tissue analyses.
The letter to George W. Corner gives a review of his scientific achievements up to 1959.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical order and in chronological order within name.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.
